Gaussian Process Force Fields¶

Gaussian process model of the Born Oppenheimer potential energy surface.

class flare.gp.GaussianProcess(kernel: Callable, kernel_grad: Callable, hyps, cutoffs, hyp_labels: List = None, energy_force_kernel: Callable = None, energy_kernel: Callable = None, opt_algorithm: str = 'L-BFGS-B', maxiter=10, par=False, no_cpus=None, output=None)¶

Gaussian Process Regression Model. Implementation is based on Algorithm 2.1 (pg. 19) of “Gaussian Processes for Machine Learning” by Rasmussen and Williams

add_one_env(env: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment, force, train: bool = False, **kwargs)¶

Tool to add a single environment / force pair into the training set. :param force: :param env: :param force: (x,y,z) component associated with environment :param train: :return:

as_dict()¶

Dictionary representation of the GP model.

en_kern_vec(x: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment)¶

Compute the vector of energy/force kernels between an atomic environment and the environments in the training set.

static force_list_to_np(forces: list)¶

Convert list of forces to numpy array of forces. :param forces: list of forces to convert :type forces: list<float> :return: numpy array forces :rtype: np.ndarray

static from_dict(dictionary)¶

Create GP object from dictionary representation.

get_kernel_vector(x: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment, d_1: int)¶

Compute kernel vector, comparing input environment to all environments in the GP’s training set. :param x: data point to compare against kernel matrix :type x: AtomicEnvironment :param d_1: Cartesian component of force vector to get (1=x,2=y,3=z) :type d_1: int :return: kernel vector :rtype: np.ndarray

predict(x_t: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment, d: int) → [<class 'float'>, <class 'float'>]¶

Predict force component of an atomic environment and its uncertainty.

predict_local_energy(x_t: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment) → float¶

Predict the local energy of an atomic environment. :param x_t: Atomic environment of test atom. :type x_t: AtomicEnvironment :return: local energy in eV (up to a constant). :rtype: float

predict_local_energy_and_var(x_t: flare.env.AtomicEnvironment)¶

Predict the local energy of an atomic environment and its uncertainty.

set_L_alpha()¶

Invert the covariance matrix, setting L (a lower triangular matrix s.t. L L^T = (K + sig_n^2 I) ) and alpha, the inverse covariance matrix multiplied by the vector of training labels. The forces and variances are later obtained using alpha. :return:

train(output=None, custom_bounds=None, grad_tol: float = 0.0001, x_tol: float = 1e-05, line_steps: int = 20)¶

Train Gaussian Process model on training data. Tunes the hyperparameters to maximize the likelihood, then computes L and alpha (related to the covariance matrix of the training set).

update_L_alpha()¶

Update the GP’s L matrix and alpha vector.

update_db(struc: flare.struc.Structure, forces: list, custom_range: List[int] = ())¶

Given structure and forces, add to training set. :param struc: structure to add to db :type struc: Structure :param forces: list of corresponding forces to add to db :type forces: list<float> :param custom_range: Indices to use in lieu of the whole structure :type custom_range: List[int]

write_model(name: str, format: str = 'json')¶

Write model in a variety of formats to a file for later re-use.

Parameters

  • name – Output name

  • format –

Returns
